oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Confederate Monument at Dyersburg

oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Monuments; Sculpture; Plazas; Automobiles; Business districts
Monuments; Soldiers; Dyersburg (Tenn.); United States - History - Civil War, 1861-1865
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Confederate soldier outfitted in full uniform and holding his rifle stands atop shaft of granite in a corner of the Dyersburg Courthouse Square. Background consists of Courthouse yard, cars, and downtown storefronts, with people on the sidewalk.
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Tennessee Civil War Centennial Commission
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: The dedication of the Dyersburg Confederate Monument occurred on April 6, 1905, the anniversary of the Battle of Shiloh. The Dawson Bivouac of Dyersburg spearheaded the effort to raise money for the monument. Speakers at the dedication included Maecenas Benton, Gov. Jeff Davis of Arkansas, Sen. Edward Ward Carmack, Sen. James B. Frazier, Col. Luke Finley, and Samuel Rankin Latta.
